messages.title: FAIR IS WORTH FIGHTING FOR
messages.content: David Bennie, candidate in Seven Sisters ward, says 'Greens will support action to make the east of the borough as attractive as the west. We want better green spaces and all new developments to be high quality and sustainable - to meet the needs of local residents and small businesses, not big developers.' Rebecca Bunting, candidate in Harringay, says 'We will push the Council to deliver faster on Haringey's 'Greenest Borough' strategy. We need more home insulation and more action to save energy (and money) in Council buildings.'

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Greens will support action to make the east of the borough as attractive as the west, with better green spaces and high-quality, sustainable developments.
The candidate pledges to push the Council to deliver faster on Haringey's 'Greenest Borough' strategy, focusing on more home insulation and actions to save energy in Council buildings.

mentions.tacticalSituation: There are three Green candidates in every ward of Haringey. If a Green candidate gets 999 votes, and another one you voted for gets 1,000, your votes might be the last vote that kept the Green out.

issues.economy: State pension of £170 per week per person, no means testing. Better benefits for the unwaged and carers. A living wage - paying at least £8.10 per hour.
issues.environment: More good quality housing that ordinary people can afford.
issues.governance: No to ID cards and no to Trident. Troops out of Iraq and Afghanistan
issues.health: Fight hospital closures,fight privatisation in the NHS
issues.socialWelfare: A million new jobs, in home free insulation, investment in solar and wind power, better health and social services

housing.content: More good quality housing that ordinary people can afford.

contactInformation.address: Mollison House, Aden Road, Enfield, EN3 7SY

images.caption: Photos of Pete McKaskie and Anne Gray

leaflet.additionalNotes: Published by Haringey Green Party by George Mackie, 10 Crosfield Rd, N17 7AY. Printed by Wernham Printers.
